intro: Clerodendrum silvanum var. brevitubum, commonly known as the short-stemmed glorybower, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and has opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The flowers are pollinated by birds and insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
